EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.99}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Postdoc on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Postdoc on the y-axis is {0.99}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Freshman on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Freshman on the y-axis is {0.51}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Engineering on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Engineering on the x-axis is {0.75}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Literature and Researcher or the cell corresponding to Geography and Staff?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Geography} and {Staff} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Chemistry and Admin or the cell corresponding to Economics and Senior?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Chemistry} and {Admin} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Arts and Faculty or the cell corresponding to Arts and Researcher?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Arts} and {Researcher} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Arts and Sophomore or the cell corresponding to Economics and Sophomore?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Arts} and {Sophomore} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.60 to 0.78?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Arts, Admin), (Geography, Faculty), (Arts, Freshman), (Engineering, Freshman), (Engineering, Graduate), (Chemistry, Junior), (Geography, Junior), (Arts, Postdoc), (Literature, Postdoc), (Geography, Researcher), (Literature, Senior), (Physics, Senior), (Engineering, Sophomore), (Literature, Staff)}.
